      • id

        public long id()
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Returns the session ID.

        The session ID is unique to an individual session within the cluster. That is, it is guaranteed that no two clients will have a session with the same ID.

        Specified by:
        id in interface Session
        Returns:
        The session ID.

      • onOpen

        public Listener<Session> onOpen(Consumer<Session> listener)
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Sets an open listener on the session.

        The provided Consumer will be called once the session has been registered with the Raft cluster. If the session is already open at the time of this method call, the provided Consumer will be immediately called in the session thread.

        Specified by:
        onOpen in interface Session
        Parameters:
        listener - The session open listener.
        Returns:
        The listener context.

      • publish

        public CompletableFuture<Void> publish(Object message)
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Publishes a message to the session.

        When a message is published via the Session, it is sent to the other side of the session's connection. If the message is sent from the client-side of the session, the message will be sent to a single Raft server and vice-versa. Sessions guarantee linearizability. If a message is sent from a Raft server to a client that is disconnected or otherwise can't receive the message, the message will be resent once the client connects to another server as long as the session has not expired.

        The returned CompletableFuture will be completed once the message has been sent but not necessarily received by the other side of the connection. In the event of a network or other failure, the message may be resent.

        Specified by:
        publish in interface Session
        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be called once the message has been published.

      • onReceive

        public Listener<?> onReceive(Consumer listener)
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Registers a message receive listener.

        The registered Consumer will be called when a message is received from the Raft cluster for the session. Session implementations must guarantee that consumers are always called in the same thread for the session. Therefore, no two messages will be received concurrently by the session.

        Specified by:
        onReceive in interface Session
        Parameters:
        listener - The session receive listener.
        Returns:
        The listener context.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the session is closed.

        This method will return true if the session was closed via normal means or via a session expiration. To determine whether the session expired use Session.isExpired().

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface Session
        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface Managed<Session>
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the session is closed.

      • onClose

        public Listener<Session> onClose(Consumer<Session> listener)
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Sets a session close listener.

        The registered close Consumer will be called once the session is closed either via an explicit invocation of a Managed session or by a session expiration. If the session was closed normally, Session.isClosed() will return true and Session.isExpired() will false, otherwise if the session expired then both will return true.

        Specified by:
        onClose in interface Session
        Parameters:
        listener - The session close listener.
        Returns:
        The session.

        Description copied from interface: Session
